name: NSDiscardableContent
desc: You implement this protocol when a classâ€™s objects have subcomponents that can be discarded when not being used, thereby giving an application a smaller memory footprint.

items.name: func beginContentAccess() -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the discardable contents are still available and have been successfully accessed.

items.name: func endContentAccess()
items.desc: Called if the discardable contents are no longer being accessed.

items.name: func discardContentIfPossible()
items.desc: Called to discard the contents of the receiver if the value of the accessed counter is 0.

items.name: func isContentDiscarded() -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the content has been discarded.
